column4: that's always been an annoyance on linux. it's easy to f*** up the system
yes... although he would rather you go to the wiki to see that...
dpkg -l libmad0 if ya don't believe me  ;)
libmad0 is a dependency of amarok i believe
actually, it's a dependency of mplayer
irrelivant... its on your system... and thats why XMMS can play MP3's
but as i said- IF you installed gstreamer0.8-mad you would have libmad0
so the solution for all players is "sudo apt-get install gstreamer0.8-mad"- not just gstreamer based players
technically though, yes... although with KDE, you need akode-mad.... but then, thats not even listed on that page... so I guess thats not important
apokryphos is way ahead of you... but thanks for your input
